[8208747]

A2: In order for the trap to be activated you must interact in some way with the room equipment.

For example: clicking on the shelf or dropping an item doesn't count as an action. Accessing a console or picking up items counts.

On april 20, 2014
Misterme7

Q4 How do we find the the ship glory page that people link to in their AP threads? I'm fairly sure a ship I died on is done because they had 6 oxygen when I died but I don't remember getting a notification like it said.
On april 20, 2014
[6826491]

A4: My Account -> "My File" tab. You'll see all of your games there, including the last one (if you died early, then it will appear here once it's finished.) The "Honors" link for each game will take you to its end screen. You can even see the end screen when it shows up after the end of your ship, but before you leave your last words and confirm your ending. (This is a good way to know if you have sneaky Mush to congratulate or shake your fist at in your own last words!)

The notification you receive that a game has "finished up" only comes 7 days to the exact cycle after a ship is completed, OR after everyone has confirmed their deaths - whichever of the two is first. Usually, due to inactive players, mosh crews do have to wait a week to see the likes and usernames of their crewmates.

A 5 and 5.2
They don't detect it, and they won't detect either after the update. For now they only detect direct spiking. Sorveevur

Q8: A bit of a non-advice question but I don't want to go making a new thread in the lounge or discussion forums.

How big do you reckon spores are, and how does spiking actually work? Do you just shove a huge glob of pink material onto their heads or are they tiny and spread in some other way? Just curious.
On april 20, 2014
Cimanyd

About Q8:
Ian's biography3147 While carrying out tests on the sample, Ian identified a layer of complex mycelium which he managed to introduce into a rat. The mycelium spread throughout the spinal marrow of the animal without seeming to affect the animal. Once the subject was placed amongst other rats, the infected subject exhibited unusual behaviour during which the rat would vomit a spore of 1mm diameter and transports it to a group of healthy rats. Upon contact with spores, healthy subjects undergo three stages of infection at the end of which the mycelium binds to the subject. Ian sent the findings of his research to Eleesha who compiled a report of their work for the scientific press.

Spores are probably vomited by humans in the game, just like the rats there, which would explain why it's easily noticed by others and why it makes the mush dirty. (When humans vomit from illnesses, they get dirty, even with the apron. Extracting a spore is the same.)

As for spiking, remember it isn't noticed at all by the person spiked, even when they're still human.

So, infected people vomit a tiny spore (1mm for the rat, it's probably still small for humans), store it somehow, then transfer it to a non-infected human without that human or any others noticing.

On april 22, 2014
[8147734]

On april 22, 2014
Cimanyd

A18
Coffee doesn't have any "satisfaction," meaning you can drink as much of it as you want, if you aren't already full (or a Mush). However, it does stop starvation, so if your ship is out of rations, make sure you use the daily coffee wisely. (Or, if you have PILGRED, just have any starving person use coffee. Enough coffee is made with PILGRED to give everyone one in two days, it takes three days to starve.)
On april 22, 2014
Red3eard

Q19 How does the pilot upgrade for drones work? Does it require any NERON upgrades not make it not suck, or is it good just on it's own? Is it possible the drones can get left in space with a jump towards a planet?
On april 22, 2014
Kyubey

A19
How does the pilot upgrade for drones work?
If there are hunters outside and drone is in room with patrol ship, he will take off.
If there are hunters outside and drone already flying, he will shot.
If all hunters are killed or patrol ship is out of ammo, drone will land.
Is it possible the drones can get left in space with a jump towards a planet?
Yes, you will easily lose drone and patrol ship.
Does it require any NERON upgrades not make it not suck, or is it good just on it's own?
Magnetic net is very useful to move ship in time, without waiting drones to return.
Blaster gun helps drones like it helps humans to do more damage every shot.
Other project don't help much or at all. For example Launch Propulsion System does nothing - drone always take off with single action.

[1820396]

A20: Next season, Mycoalarms will detect more than just spiking actions, and it will definitely be optimal to keep them hidden. Some people think it's a good idea to name where 1-2 of the alarms are placed (not hidden) so they act as a relatively safer area to be in. It will deter spiking in those named rooms, at least. The others would be hidden, of course.

I personally try to hide them when I play Chun (and have verified humans assist in placement, if needed).

On april 22, 2014
hottest

Q22:
If you get any injury, does it lower your max HP?
If so, how much? Is it the same for any kind of injuries?
On april 22, 2014
Sorveevur

A16: No, it appears as you hurting yourself in the heat of the action.
On april 22, 2014
SummerMcLovin

A22: Unless I missed out another one that has the effect listed here, only Bruised Shoulder reduces your max health by 1. A lot of Injuries reduce your health each turn of course, but you can still be healed to 14/16 until surgery fixes them.
As you can also see on that page, a lot of Illnesses reduce your max health.
On april 22, 2014
[6826491]

A22: Each injury reduces your max. HP by one, before the damage from the hit that causes the injury is applied. So three injuries from a single wound, on fully healed a Gold player will reduce their max. HP to 13, not including the effects of those injuries, and then the normal damage from the hit is applied. And yes, you can get multiple injuries from a single hit.

This usually explains why a final hit may cause something like Bled Out. The injury reduced their HP to zero before the normal damage from the hit was applied.
On april 22, 2014
blue4029

Q23 is there a fault in going to sleep in real life when your currently playing jin su and then once you wake up you wake up to a crew of people who yell at you for not being active (I WAS ASLEEP...and I already told them my timezone and schedule) and once I do become active I make up for what I miss by steering the ship into a planet with O2? the crew voted to kill me even though I have been active to do useful things COUNTLESS times and yesterday people were being nice to eachother...
On april 22, 2014
[6826491]

A23: Ideally, the Commander should be available to move the ship as often as every other cycle, if necessary. In voyages lasting 15+ days, this can really keep you alive. Of course, that's not always possible to accomplish, so you do what you can to be there, and to know the full situation before taking action.

Even if I'm not Commander, I usually give my crew an estimate of when I should be back on that day, and I stick to it. It sounds like you tried to do the same, but your schedule doesn't match up to the rest of your crew's. Is it your fault that your schedule caused some issues on your ship? Probably not. But if you're not there (whether or not you want to be) when they need you, it might be wise to avoid the Commander role in the future.

That said, if your sleeping time is between cycles 2-3, no new hunters show up in those cycles, unless you move the ship.

Does a drone with firefighter actually put out fires or does it just make the drone fireproof? (The wiki isn't very clear)
On april 22, 2014
[6826491]
DewyQ24: Does a drone with firefighter actually put out fires or does it just make the drone fireproof? (The wiki isn't very clear)

A24: Yes, and yes. If placed in a room on fire, it will put out the fire as its action next cycle (or first action, in case it has Turbo.) It will do this before the fire can damage any thing else in the room. It will also be fireproof, so fires won't break it like it would break other drones.

SummerMcLovin

A28: iTrakie/Walkie Talkie and Tracker are all private items which don't leave public logs of being dropped, nor can anyone else pick them up. The only danger is if a Mush Transfers into you, usually having dropped and/or hidden their Walkie Talkie somewhere to stop you easily outing them.

However, to answer your question, people do drop the items they were carrying in the room they died in. This is technically true for Patrol Ships/the Pasiphae and expeditions, although there is no way to access those rooms so the items are lost.

On april 23, 2014
MechanisMs

A33? - Coffee (which is guaranteed if this hypothetical member has the opportunity for a hostile Sol jump) and pot grown fruits will all help a starving or soon-to-be starving crewmember stave off starvation. The idea of an "Eden clique" that starves out a player that has the opportunity to unilaterally send the crew to Sol (either captain or someone in possession of hacker kit) seems a bit absurdist unless you're speaking from experience, every member is valuable in an Eden trip so long as they spend their AP positively towards the goal of Eden.

What has been consistently preached by the mods, however, is that the unilateral decision (going out of your way to disobey the will of the majority of the ship) to Sol jump can and should be considered a reportable offense. Especially if it's something as easy to solve as "being starved out". Cycle 1 (for plants), or being in kitchen at the start of any cycle after pilgred has been finished will suffice to survive starvation. Even if you extend the hypothetical to include injuries, there is an extremely narrow window for a justified unilateral jump then: you would have to be on bridge as captain, find yourself without enough AP to reach medlab to self-heal, too low HP to "risk" another cycle of random damage possibility, and enough AP to end game with Sol/Eden.

SummerMcLovin

A28: iTrakie/Walkie Talkie and Tracker are all private items which don't leave public logs of being dropped, nor can anyone else pick them up. The only danger is if a Mush Transfers into you, usually having dropped and/or hidden their Walkie Talkie somewhere to stop you easily outing them.

In theory, items should be dropped in the local space too if someone dies in a Pasiphae. But since we have only 1 Pasiphae, so...

Disclaimer: I haven't personally tried it but this is what I understand.

Q47:
Follow-up questions from an answer in previous Q/A.

Anyone can hybridize, but the 3 AP cost to do this can be expensive, which is why botanist points are preferred. To avoid wasting your botanist points to water/treat the target plant beforehand, let someone else use their AP, especially for watering. Treating with botanist points depends on how many points you have, and if you have someone with the AP to spare for you.

Q47a
3AP cost? I think it is just 2AP.
Is it a typo?

The Green Thumb skill and Hydroponic Incubator project each reduce the total number of required cycles for maturity by two; the latter only works if the plants are in the Garden (even in your inventory!). This reduction doesn't help too much with bananas, since they take so long, but most alien fruits mature in about a day to a day and a half...often less. The benefits in that situation are quite noticeable with alien fruits, especially if you're planting Jumpkins. I've seen alien fruit mature in just 2-4 cycles, for example.

Q47b
Doesn't Hydroponic Incubator cut the mature period by half?
How come it reduces 2 cycles only? It does not match the in-game description. Are you sure?

Q47c
It said it even works in your inventory. How exactly does it work?
Does the person need to stay in the garden all the time, or just in the garden during cycle change?

Q47d
Does Green Thumb reduction of 2 cycles only works when he hybridizes a plant?

Q64 During expeditions, how do creature fights actually work?
e.g. You are facing off against a creature. Creature Strength: 32
On april 26, 2014
SummerMcLovin

A64: The creature's strength is compared to your expedition group's, which is 1 per member plus any bonus from weaponry. The difference is the damage done to your team, and is assigned randomly (not usually equally) between the various members.

q70 How does one repair the hull of the Daedalus?
On april 26, 2014
1412
Misterme7q70 How does one repair the hull of the Daedalus?

A70: Find some metal scrap. Click on it. There should be a button to reinforce the hull of the daedalus.
On april 26, 2014
Cimanyd

A70
You need scrap metal. Scrap metal is gained by collecting scrap with the Pasiphae or dismantling objects.

The scrap metal will have an option to "strengthen" or something, I don't remember. It's a 25% base chance, increased by being a technician, holding a wrench, and holding an oscilloscope. It doesn't use the scrap metal if it fails. If it succeeds, the metal is used and it will increase the hull by 5 points.

This is important. If you are holding an oscilloscope, not only does it increase the chance of success, it also doubles the amount of hull repaired, making it 10. If you have an oscilloscope blueprint on your ship, build it before doing repairs, and make sure to use it. Build it in Alpha Bay 2 (where the Pasiphae is), it's heavy, so if you build it elsewhere you'll waste AP moving it.

On april 29, 2014
[6826491]

Mush are made full by consuming anything regardless of its satisfaction value, be it coffee, a pill, or any food.

If as a human you have coffee, a pill, a fruit, and a ration, it's quite possible to consume all of them in a cycle by consuming the coffee/pill first, then the fruit, and then the ration. This assumes that eating the fruit won't put you to 3 satisfaction. In that case, you could consume the first two, skip the fruit, and then eat the ration.

[7971963]

I have a rules question.

Q96 - If we have solid reason to believe our human commander is going to perform a "Hostile Return to Sol" (Such as, he explicitly said he would do so), would it be permissible to kill him to prevent it if the crew does not wish to return? (For example, if we wanted to try for a ticket or the Serum?)
On may 1, 2014
[6826491]

A96: Warn him that he'll be reported for initiating a harmful return, and if necessary, set someone on guard in the front corridor to prevent it. If the commander uses force to remove the guarding player, killing him is the natural response to his action. Unless the ship's condition is dire, OR there is a consensus to return early at a specific point, your ship ideally should keep going until either of those conditions is met.

It's especially sanctionable if just one person wants to end their ship early, so that they can join a community jump. That's one of the most common reasons for someone initiating a Harmful Return, and that can potentially lead to a quarantine on that next ship. No community jump is worth that risk!

(And is this intended or a bug?) I double/triple-checked that I was sending it to the right person.
On may 2, 2014
[7950824]

A98 When you sent the mission, it went to the person you sent it to. However, if you clicked the button to the right of the person's name, you actually sent it to someone else - this is true even if there is no button to the left of the person's name. There's a spacing bug and it's possible for the button that should be on the left of the person's name to appear on the line above. However the only way to give someone a mission is to give it to a person through the button immediately left of their name. Once you give someone a mission, it's theirs until revoked or accepted. Doesn't matter if you lose the title, if the day changes, or whatever... though once you give a new mission you can only revoke the newest one.

[7950824]

A99 No one says that humans, or mush, have to be stupid or even play for the fastest possible win. If you play to win for your side, you're playing right. There's many ways to win and as long as your plan is workable and

Remember, and take into account, that the mush that appears to help you at the moment may well be the mush that moves to destroy you in the next moment. You are 100% allowed to follow strategies that help your team win. These strategies could combine a plan to delay killing either mush and allowing them to both believe they are not detected while the team gathers the AP necessary to kill one of the mush, finish the cure that cycle, and cure the other before they have time to react.

If, say, I realized that Janice, who had diplomat and was vital for keeping morale up was a mush and I didn't know who the other was, I would be quite interested in 'keeping the illusion up' if it was probably realistic that we had no idea Janice was mush, while 'accidentally' giving her no conversion chances, trying to give her 'good ways to fit in' that will keep her AP from being very full, and frantically trying to figure out who the other mush is...


...so the other mush can be killed, the cure made, and Janice converted back to human for the benefit of human morale and vastly increased odds of reaching Eden with her alive and human instead of dead for being a mush.

Giving the ship a chance to live longer and achieve more easier than if the more obvious, direct, and fast answers to 'I caught a mush' are used.

Or the ship can just kill her outright.... even when that actually harms the ship's chances compared to the cure route, well. That's not even considered playing against the team. Long as the behavior is reasonable and not clearly done for malicious reasons, all is fair, just keep trying to win.

On may 3, 2014
SummerMcLovin

A117: There will be no announcements for those who died while they were turned off, but if people were to die after they were re-enabled, there would be a NERON announcement for them. Also note that you can use Vocoder Announcements, the /neron chat option, to 'cover up' that you turned them off, if you happen to be around at the Cycle change where they die (or whatever other reason you want to).

A118: Mushpedia only includes that as a recommendation of course, so you can do whatever you want, but I'll explain the logic behind it so you can make up your own mind.

Early on, the NERON Updates are easy enough to get: the first one can take only 2-3, the second a few more but still fairly manageable in one go, not so much after that (but you might run out of other Comm work later). Each completed upgrade will give you a NERON Project that hasn't been offered as an option in the Nexus (including the current ones).
One of the Xyloph Database entries is a collection of Janice's work on NERON, which increases the current NERON Update by 25%. For example, if you had completed two and worked on the third to get it to 12%, finding that Xyloph entry would increase it to 37% and you can continue working on either (and/or Rebel Bases). As with the other entries, it is a one-time bonus and cannot be found again.

Q131 whats the difference between medic and nurse?
On may 4, 2014
1412
blue4029Q131 whats the difference between medic and nurse?

Medic gives a research bonus.
On may 4, 2014
[6826491]
KersakofQ130 But what if I don't? Do I get to choose again if I get 3 or more?

A130: If you're Gold with a level 4 character, your skills will still be automatically selected at the start of the ship.

Basically, to choose your skills manually at the start, you need level 2 for Bronze, level 3 for Silver, and level 5 for Gold.

A131: Medic allows the player to perform surgeries on other players, in addition to the research bonus, the +2 bonus to each healing action, and the ability to read pill properties.

Nurse only allows up to two free healing actions, which can include DIY surgery, and the ability to read pill properties. The ability to perform DIY surgery for free can literally save the life of an injured Chun.
On may 4, 2014
SummerMcLovin

A131: As well as the Research bonus mentioned by 1412, you can perform Surgeries using the Medkit and any healing you will include a +2 Health gain.
Nurse doesn't include any of the above, but you get one free healing action per day instead of using AP.
They both allow you to read the properties of pills, as does Biologist.

And... ninja-d Didn't think about the DIY Surgery aspect before, that's interesting.

DarkTheRaven

Q132 Why do we knock over the coffee every time we use the coffee machine, and does it actually have an effect?
On may 5, 2014
Adoncia

A132: Knocking an item over means that you have no room for it in your inventory, and it has dropped to the shelf. You will not knock the coffee over if you have inventory space. It doesn't affect the coffee at all.
On may 5, 2014
[6826491]

A132: On a related note, if someone wants to prove their humanity by buying a vendor consumable, they should have a full inventory at the time they purchase it. If they knock it over, they definitely bought it at that moment, and are therefore human. If they just drop it, then it's reasonable to guess that it could have been bought prior to Mush selection.
On may 5, 2014
Misterme7

Q133 How do zones that make you lose an item work exactly? How does it choose which item in your inventory is lost?
On may 5, 2014
[6826491]

A133: Basically, a random player is chosen, and then one of their items is randomly chosen, then removed permanently. If this is your WT/iTrakie, you might not be able to communicate for a while (short of being the Comms officer, being on the bridge all the time, or having Bransync online). This is why you're often told to drop your WT/Tracker before going on any expo. Obviously, if you only have 1-2 items when an item is lost or stolen, you have terrible odds of that lost item being something you'd need.

To counter this somewhat, many players use post it notes to fill any empty slots in their inventory. (To make things less cluttered, make the messages identical for each note you write, and they'll stack on the shelf after you return.)
On may 5, 2014
[8276512]

Q134: Can Fuel not be dropped?
On may 5, 2014
[6826491]

A134: Once it's in your inventory, you can inject it into one of the two fuel tanks, or into the combustion chamber. There's no other way to remove it from your inventory. The fuel tanks are usually the safer option, since you always need the exact amount of fuel to travel anywhere.

SummerMcLovin

A139: The only way to not leave logs when hiding an item is to do it in an empty room (no people or Cameras) without having picked it up. However, should anyone have noticed it used to be there, they may be able to work out it was hidden and that it was you.
If you want to pick it up again, you will leave a log. You could pass it off as having worked out the above scenario and blaming someone else, but if you want to use it generally it's a pretty obvious Mush action like killing an expo team and/or Pilots, or getting an infected Sol return victory.

A140: It will leave the Public log for that room that anyone who goes there (and since an alarm was placed there I assume it's fairly busy) can see, but there is no NERON announcement or any mention in the Alerts bar.

Misterme7
LastlawyerI'm sure this has been asked before but I can't find it... how often can a human eat? Once a cycle, once every two cycles? And does this apply to vendor food like the squid bar?

Humans have satisfaction. Each food item has individual satisfaction values. Most fruits have one, rations have four, vendor food has what's on the box. Once a human hits three satisfaction or more he cannot eat until it drops below that. You lose one satisfaction each cycle, more with tapeworm.

A149- A sophisticated mush investigation team would know that human characters taking starvation damage shake as if taking damage from an environmental effect (roof collapse) on the cycle changes when they take their starvation damage. Postnote: if you have developed an actual mental illness that is treatable by lying in the same room as Janice then it serves as a pretty reliable piece of circumstantial evidence that you are human as well.

Q 150: If you join a ship as a level two silver character will you be forced to take skills 1 and 2? Or does it give you the chance to wait on your skills and level up later?
On may 6, 2014
[6826491]

A150: It depends upon that character's level. If you have more skills than skill slots available (i.e. level 3 or higher for Silver) then you may choose your skills manually. If you have equal to or fewer skills than skill slots, they are automatically chosen for you.

So to manually choose your skills at the start of the ship, you need:

Level 2 for Bronze
Level 3 for Silver
Level 5 for Gold

On may 8, 2014
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

Why do people always say that you have to relaunch an expedition if someone's lost ? You don't always have to.

When someone gets lost, an additional MIA zone is created on the planet, which will be visited just like the other zones. It can have three possible results : Wander (you find nothing and the zone can be explored again later), Reunited (you find your crewmate alive and they gain 3 morale), or Death (you find them dead, and it has nothing to do with their morale).

You may have to launch again if you haven't visited it during the first expedition (in that case, if you wait, your crewmate stays alive and loses 2 morale per cycle), but you can also visit the zone during the first expedition.
On may 8, 2014

On may 10, 2014
[8206731]

i'm not playing eleesha, i'm in a room with her and the log says that she has noticed something interesting
On may 10, 2014
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

She can't notice something that the camera doesn't reveal. Two things can happen :

- Someone does a covert action (spiking, demoralizing...) in her presence, and the action is immediately revealed, as if Eleesha was a camera. That's not what happened on your ship, because you would see that action in red next to the message saying "Eleesha has noticed...", and the camera would have seen it too.

- Someone does a secret action (extracting a spore, trapping a room, but also eating or hiding objects) in a room with cameras and witnesses, or a covert action in a room with a camera. The action is revealed because of the camera or witnesses. Eleesha can "notice" it several cycles later when she enters the room, refreshes the page or does something. That's what must have happened.
On may 10, 2014
[8206731]

but she has been sleeping in the room for a cycle already, and it just poped up now. The exact message is

Eleesha has noticed something interesting... ~1h

And there is a camera in the room, is this from observent or something else as she hasen't moved or done anything the cycle it appeared.

perhaps from a skill that says its covert, but isn't caught by cameras like green jelly?
On may 10, 2014
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

The message is always "Eleesha has noticed something interesting", and yes, it is from Observant. Scroll down the room logs and look for an action in red (probably someone eating).

As I said, Eleesha doesn't have to actually do something for the message to appear. Maybe she just refreshed the page, or sometimes examining the shelf or other invisible actions trigger the message. Sometimes it is also triggered by someone else doing something. And by "triggered", I mean that it causes Eleesha to notice a secret action that happened before and that was already revealed by the camera.

For example :
- Cycle 1, Terrence eats in the dorm. The action is visible because there is a camera.
- Cycle 3, Eleesha enters / refreshes the page / does something. The message "Eleesha has noticed something interesting" appears, because she has noticed Terrence eating.

On may 11, 2014
Cimanyd
Too_TonQ181 Need quick answer/ Where is the central bravo storage where oxygen is?Too_TonQ182 what is the purpose of grabbing oxygen? can you hide it or something?

A181 and A182:
Oxygen tanks are in both central storages. Oxygen capsules (1 oxygen in each) can be taken from them and put into them, and one extra oxygen is lost each cycle for each broken tank (so 2/cycle with one broken, 3/cycle with both broken). Oxygen capsules can't be dropped, hidden, or anything, they can only be put back into a tank.

If there is 0 oxygen left on cycle change (including the cycle it changes to 0 oxygen), one random player is selected. If they are holding at least one oxygen capsule, they lose one oxygen capsule. If not, they die.

So, it would be a possible mush strategy to take out the last few capsules if you're very low, forcing someone to die, and making sure you won't die for quite a while. This could also be combined with sabotage of a tank, depending on the circumstances.

For example, you have 4 oxygen, very dangerous, definitely, but still 3 cycles of safety. If you take out 2 oxygen capsules, then sabotage a tank, now there is no safety and someone will die the next cycle change... unless you're selected, then you won't die. You can't die until you've been selected three times, since you are holding the capsules.
On may 11, 2014

A186: Yes, that's something reasonable to ask of people, if they want to volunteer (and having +2 morale per day can be quite helpful.) Like a Torture test, it can still be defeated, too. A Mush might just wait until after they chitchat, and then try to do their Mushy actions for the day. This is quite possible, so it's not foolproof.

And when it comes to someone who is already suspected (with some evidence) then you can ask them to clear themselves with a test. They still have the right to decline the test, and if you kill them, it would have to be based on the existing evidence.

Q189: Is there any point in upgrading any human skills if you are bronze? Even chun needs mankinds last hope, ian needs his plant stuff. Only mush and maybe stephen needs xp
On may 12, 2014
blue4029
Too_TonQ189: Is there any point in upgrading any human skills if you are bronze? Even chun needs mankinds last hope, ian needs his plant stuff. Only mush and maybe stephen needs xp

it usually depends on the character,for instance a level two roland gets the pilot skill which is used to earn glory,and a level 3 gioele could use the AP from the caffeine junky skill
On may 12, 2014
Cimanyd

A189:
Many characters have their best skill, or just a needed one, at level 1, yes, but these aren't like that:
Roland is the most obvious one, with Sprinter as L1 and Pilot (much more useful and needed for a good ship) as L2.
Gioele's L2, 3, and 4 skills are all more useful than L1 Solid, so have him at least L2 for Paranoid.
Terrence's L2 Technician is more useful than L1 Robotics Expert.
Raluca's L3 Technician is probably more useful than L1 Physicist, and still provides a PILGRED/Plasma Shield bonus. (Techs are important!)
Andie's L3 Polyvalent is almost certainly more useful than L1 Pilot, since without it there might not be anyone on the ship with a skill that boosts anti-mush research. If you're going to play Andie, go with Polyvalent.
Finola (and yes, I know she isn't around right now) has L2 Medic, which has the same usefulness as L1 Biologist as well as better heals and the ability to do surgery.
Paola's L2 Logistics Expert is debatably more useful than L1 Radio Expert. It all depends on how good the ship is, so it might be a good idea to level her up once just so you have the choice.
Stephen's L5 Apprentice is certainly his best skill but obviously that requires a lot of XP so you wouldn't get it unless you've been playing for a long time and like Stephen. However, L2 Solid might be more useful with the new season and the throwing out of rooms.
Chao's L4 Torturer is probably most useful, and L3 Wrestler is still good for combat and can throw out of rooms.

Short version:
Necessary in my opinion: Roland 2, Gioele 2, Terrence 2, Andie 3.
Possibly or probably good: Raluca 3, Finola 2, Paola 2, Stephen 2, Gioele 3, Chao 3.
Long-term: Stephen 5, Chao 4.

A191: Playing a Paola Mush is one of the more difficult Mush roles (almost as bad as Mush Finola) because you really have no reason to be dirty or to be far away from the Bridge. You really need to play the long game. Do the Comms work, of course (You need to to hide yourself) but make sure to save AP to make you move when you can. Once Xyloph is finished this is easy enough if you have your Sofa. Use your skills to your advantage: if the Bridge isn't assigned a camera, use Slimetrap to help pin the blame on other characters. On days when you have bad rebel bases, you can do grunt work as an excuse to extract a spore. Your stratagy has to revolve around getting others killed rather then converting them: leave that to your partner. Just be careful with your AP though: if you need to get a rebel base and you miss is because you can't eat to get AP, then you're in for a world of hurt.

DarkTheRaven

Q205
Can i bring the cat through the mycoscanner to check for infectious cuddles?
On may 14, 2014
Cimanyd
DarkTheRavenQ205
Can i bring the cat through the mycoscanner to check for infectious cuddles?

A205: No. To check if the cat is infected, use the mycoscanner on yourself to see your spore count, then pick up and drop the cat over and over until you get 2 damage. Then scan yourself again. If the cat was infected, you'll have another spore, since that damage is what transfers them. If not, your spores will be the same.

(Obviously, don't do this if you're one spore away from being mush, it would convert you.)
On may 14, 2014

A207: In my opinion, it really ruins the spirit of the game. Like it was said above, it's pretty impossible for MUSH to fake the food test. It makes for lazy detective work, too. On my current ship I've found and detective 3 active MUSH and have ended the MUSH hunt. I didn't use tests and I was never 100% in my findings but that's the game. If you make a mistake it's your mistake and you will learn from it but if you succeed then you'll have actually earned it. That's what this game is about. A207.2: No matter what, if you propose a food test and the person refuses you can't expect someone to just throw that out, it'll be used as evidence whether it's against the rules or not. npfan

A207.3

I just want to make clear about something before any misinformation is spread about this. The only rule related to mush tests is that you cannot kill someone solely because that person refused to take a mush test. If you already have plenty of reasons to suspect someone is a mush, you are allowed to threaten someone with death if they refuse a mush test because you already have enough reason to suspect they're guilty and that someone basically waives their right to be proven innocent if they refuse.

DarkTheRaven

A209: No, a dead Mush and the Mush Sample are separate requirements for research purposes. One of the Xyloph DB results acts as a permanent Mush Sample (in case the original is lost/stolen) but there is no "replacement" of sorts for a dead Mush.

On may 16, 2014
[6826491]
blue4029the mush STILL would be yellow in the crew bar

That's true, but knowing which of them was Mush may help determine the identity of the other Mush.

A216: If a Mush suffocates, or is assassinated, while the other(s) died from putting an end to it all, then that makes it obvious who the Mush was. A Mush won't put an end to it all under normal circumstances, though it is actually possible (and it requires a Transfer.) In most other circumstances, you might have to guess based on what they dropped after they died...say, if they got steel plated, and they dropped 2-3 O2 capsules, that's most likely your Mush.

[7901021]

Do I have to Hybridize a mature Banana tree or will young plants do?
On may 16, 2014
[7901021]

Q218 ^^ sry

On may 17, 2014
[6826491]

A217: It doesn't appear to do anything for me, either.

A218: Young banana plants are often the first target for hybridization, because their growth cycles are so long compared to alien fruit. In the meantime, you're not losing out on the O2/fruit from a mature tree. By the time you've replaced all the young banana trees with something better, you can probably (safely) start replacing the mature ones. This of course also depends on what projects you have, and if you have Green Thumb.

Q217: Is morale only lost a day change?
On may 17, 2014
Kyubey

A-Syvaris's "217"
There are lots of different ways to lose morale. Illnesses (every cycle), panic attackes (random even on every cycle change), any death on the ship (any time), some special traits like Raluca's antisocial and so on.
On may 17, 2014
1412
KyubeyA-Syvaris's "217"
There are lots of different ways to lose morale. Illnesses (every cycle), panic attackes (random even on every cycle change), any death on the ship (any time), some special traits like Raluca's antisocial and so on.

Note that death by trading and loss of morale will not cause morale loss in any other crew members.
On may 17, 2014
Sorveevur

A217 A few things can lower morale.
* One morale is lost at day change, two if Chun is an idiot/dead, and 0 if Chun is clever, alive and you have the optimist skill.
* One morale is lost every time a crewmember dies.
* Finola loses morale every cycle she is dirty.
* Raluca loses morale with every cycle ended in the company of another crew member. She also loses 3 morale when Schrodinger is killed.
* The Demoraliser mush skill can be used to lower the morale of a chosen human present in the room by 2.
* Psychological issues deal various amounts of morale damage when you get them.
* Random panic attacks at cycle change.

These are all the ones I know. If you want more causes, mushpedia is bound to have more answers.

Misterme7

Q235 How does observant work? Is it retroactive, or only when you're in the room at the tine of said action? Will the log be public, or can only you see it? Do other people know when it triggers?
On may 17, 2014
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

It works differently for secret and covert actions.

- Furtive actions (spiking, demoralizing...) : Observant reveals them and they become visible for everyone, as if Eleesha was a camera, if she is in the room at the time of the action.

- Secret actions (eating, hiding things, extracting spores, sabotage...) : Observant notices them either simultaneously or retroactively, but only if they were already visible in the logs. For example : Terrence eats, it is visible because of a camera, and 2 cycles later Eleesha enters and "notices" it (meaning that the message "Eleesha has noticed something interesting" appears in the logs). Observant can't reveal secret actions.

Q239: Has anything been changed about Eleesha's ability to print "the list" after all mush are dead? Or is it still safe to assume that if no mush are shown — but Eleesha was able to print it — there must be a mush under anonymush?
On may 18, 2014
[7971963]

A239 - Eleesha will only be able to print the list if there are mush on the ship, Beta or Alpha.

The list will always contain the name of at least one Alpha Mush. That is it. If a dead Mush is on THE list, then the names there are worthless. If there are no dead mush on THE list, then at least one person on that list is Mush.

Do note, a Mush Eleesha can lie about being able to print THE list. Also, people can be converted even if all the Mush are caught/killed (through traps, trapped consumables, or Crystallite zones)

On may 19, 2014
Kyubey

A247 It can be your tactics, but it requires special situation. Some humans will confirm they are humans by illnesses/food tests (they are often side-effects for getting a lot of ap to work more, even if nobody forces anyone), you can be caught by not getting illness from illness event on the planet, then Eleesha can print a list with just 3-4 names... If ship goes well humans will have very short list of possiable mushe. And even if they cannot find you at all it's better to kill few innocents and a mush before returning to Sol, then bring mush to Sol.
On may 19, 2014
[7950824]

A247 follow up: Noted specifically asked if it's acceptable. That's a value judgment, but in my book, the answer is yes. For sure, it is not forbidden by the rules. You'll find some players who consider it the worst mush play possible, but ghosting to Sol or Eden (Acting as perfectly human as possible) is a perfectly valid way to play as Mush.

Note that even with that playstyle, it's possible for the ship to not make it back to Sol or on to Eden. A crew with more experienced players are going to be considering the odds of beta mush and suspicious of possible sleepers. An experienced crew that hasn't caught at least 2 mush yet, or one who suspects that there are likely to be additional mush alive after killing some is simply not going to make it possible to end the game yet with a return to Sol or progress to Eden. Enforced mush testing at this point still isn't legal, nor is random killing - but you may find yourself getting serum-stuck after 'winning' an endurance contest that lasted until all but one living player was proven human through voluntary or random means. One of the ships I was on went to D19, and it was on D17 that the last unconfirmed human merrily told us of his cycle-change illness that was giving him roomlogs of vomiting to confirm. Joyously, he even asked me if I believed he was human at last

Not only is it legal to play as completely human while Mush, to the best of your ability - it's also legal to play as completely human while human, but without doing anything that only humans can do unless the ship's circumstances utterly require it. It's perfectly fine to be an unconfirmed human at the end of the game, be you really human or actually mush. But know that the RNG may be conspiring to help the humans, and a human-winning ship has the serum. Most of them -will- use it on 'the last player to confirm as human', be that an Eleesha who claims the list cannot be printed, or if that isn't an option, on the last player who realistically could still be a mush playing as a sleeper.
On may 19, 2014
Vince

Un the upside, you will have the enlightening experience to see how many ships go to hell without a Mush lifting a finger.

On the downside, expect the humans to start testing at some point if they suspect you just play 100% human and bide your time. Because there is no other reliable way to find you then.

Without wanting to start that debate, this is one of two cases where I personally find testing acceptable: To save an already doomed crewmate, and when it becomes obvious that the Mush just hide.
Though I never encountered the latter situation in 25+ ships.

Q252 How does the guard action work? I haven't seen it pop up until just now in my current ship. So what makes you able or unable to guard?
On may 20, 2014
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?
Misterme7Q252 How does the guard action work? I haven't seen it pop up until just now in my current ship. So what makes you able or unable to guard?

Your character has to be level 3 for the action to be available. When you guard a room, people can only go back the way they came from. For example, if you guard front corridor, someone coming from the bridge can only go back to the bridge. But they can do anything in the room (including attack you).

thank you im always concerned to report because i know the judges get alot of reports
On may 21, 2014
[6826491]

A258: One shouldn't even threaten to commit suicide. It's not to say the threat itself that is reportable, but if we see someone say that, and then they die by a preventable means (say, while picking up something) we're more likely to rule such a death as a pathetic suicide. The intent is established, and that works against the person who said it.

It's also true that you can't kill someone just because they refuse to subject themselves to a food test...but if you have sufficient evidence to suspect them of being Mush, you can still kill them based on the existing evidence. Basically, that test might be the tipping point that can clear them of suspicion, and if they refuse the chance, then you already have enough evidence to justify killing them.

On may 22, 2014
[6826491]

A262: It's acceptable, within reason. Nobody should question it if the player is inactive, as long as you say something first.

But to reduce the chance of being misunderstood with an active player: Ask them in the general chat, and tell them in a PM why you need the bed; then give them a cycle or two to comply. If they don't respond, then let the rest of the crew know you already tried to get through to them, and you're only kicking them out of the bed, not trying to kill them.

Following the above steps (including not using a weapon) and only making one kick attempt (since it only takes a single attempt to get them out of bed) will make it VERY clear in the logs that you 1. tried to communicate first, and 2. you gave them ample time before resorting to kicking them out. It's insurance in case anyone thinks you should be reported, or if they should attack you back. The judges will see that you weren't impatient,

As for shoving them out of the room, there are several circumstances where it may be better to do so:

1. If it's an inactive Chun, and you don't want to speed up her death.
2. If you think the player is Mush, and you want to kill them in a way that won't potentially cause mental illnesses to everyone in the dorm (I did this before killing a Mush on my current ship, in fact. Janice was in the room, and she can't use Shrink on herself, after all...)
3. If the Mush are confirmed dead, and it won't matter if they aren't under a camera at that point.

[7950824]

I believe the natamy rifle can cause instant death to humans, through headshot, or slow lingering death to humans, through smashed legs that no one can heal (assuming the 'test' is not conducted in medlab) and which prevents movement to where the wounded one can heal themself.

I noticed that people on my ships seemed to get excited when someone started killing someone. To lessen problems and reduce the number of additional and needless kills, I started talking to people. Generally around 3-8 other people. Talk to them about evidence, about their ideas about what's mushy, add people in as seems useful and appropriate....

when there's a death sentence decided, as soon as possible after it's started, explain on main channels that there was a 'jury', it was a group decision, discuss the evidence.

That has seemed to really improve the feel of the ships I've been on, and to limit the amount of murders happening on them. I recommend it. With your talkative shipmates, in a group too large for them all to be mush and ideally including Chun too (unless your Chun is one of the problems being discussed), see how people interact (that's a way to find mush too, should one or more be among the group), and if someone outside of the group really seems to care, they probably belong in it....

Use this group to discuss the specific evidence about whomever. Let other involved and interested minds know exactly what's going on, and as a group decide.....

Teamwork. Unity. Group success. Far fewer problems. Far less anger. And never, ever having to only half kill an execution target because of too many misses - the rest of the group can and will finish fast.

[6826491]

A287: They can read a mage book, though many ships will have a policy that only verified humans can read them. They will tend to kill anyone who reads a mage book without the consent of the crew. Not reportable, of course. But it might lead to a quick death.

Mush can't play against the Mush team. In other words, outing themselves or another Mush is forbidden, and so is surrendering (volunteering to be easily killed or cured). Mush can't make an offer for humans to voluntarily become Mush, just as it's forbidden for humans to offer the Mush the chance to be cured. You have to play for your team, after all.

The SDF also highly discourages the act of "being an asshole"... By that, we mean trying to get the humans (particularly newbies) to break the rules, because it spoils the game for both sides, and is considered very bad form. (The last one is quite serious, and doing it doesn't make the game fun...it just leads to sanctions.)

goatPeople have been telling me they only get thirsty cycle 1

Dried Out plants will die regardless of age after Cycle 8 though.

Spazticus

Natural fires always happen the moment the cycle change does, and Neron will announce each new one.

When you say the announced time changes, is that a pop-up announcement or a chat announcement?
On may 26, 2014
[6826491]
LastlawyerWhen you say the announced time changes, is that a pop-up announcement or a chat announcement?

I'm referring specifically to the Neron announcement of a fire, in the General Chat. They are only ever announced at the moment the cycle changes, because no natural accidents/fires occur mid-cycle.

But if you had the game still open the previous cycle, and refresh 30 minutes into the next cycle, the time under the Neron announcements (say, a fire) will usually read as "moments ago". It actually happened 30 minutes ago, and when you refresh the page again, the time under the same announcement(s) will change to 30 minutes ago, or however long had passed since the cycle change.

Misterme7

Q298 If both oxygen tanks break, does the Daedalus lose 3 oxygen or still two?
On may 28, 2014
[6826491]

A297: The game officially starts when one of these conditions is met:

1. The last person wakes up.

2. The game reaches Day 4 without the ship filling.

Obviously, condition 2 is very rarely, if ever, met. But it was important during beta, because of how few players there were initially. To directly answer your question though, a ship can easily be destroyed before Day 4, if the crew ignores the hunters entirely. Also, a crew that did this intentionally could be sanctioned for playing against their team, so that's not something to even consider doing.

A298: It'll be reassigned in the same cycle the current title holder suffocates, just as if they'd died naturally from starvation, injuries, or suicide.

A299: The ship will lose one extra O2 per cycle, per broken tank. So if both tanks are broken, the ship loses 3 O2 per cycle.

On may 29, 2014
[7950824]

A302 Only the most recent one remains in 'always viewable history', however a splash screen will appear for everyone except yourself for each announcement you made. If someone is offline when you made your multiple announcements, each time they clear the oldest splash screen they'll view the next, with no indication of how many more are to come. This can get extremely aggravating late game when lag is bad, so consider being careful about how often you use your announcements - though good, sporadic announcements can be very useful!

[7921689]

On may 29, 2014
[7950824]

A303: Storyline: essentially, your ship and the research it can do are the last hope mankind has of survival. The mush are parasitic 'control you' life forms. There's a couple people controlled by mush with you (and/or you might be one of these mush), the spaceships firing at you are piloted by mush, and the Earth solar system has been taken over by mush. To 'win', you need to finish the cure and fix the Pilgred reactor, which will allow your ship to jump back to Sol - and you have to get back to sol with the Cure and without living mush aboard.... There's a secondary harder win, finding a means to reach the Fabled Eden (which also requires Pilgred), a place the mush have never been; go there with the cure and without living mush and again, your ship wins.


It's assumed that if you go back to Sol or on to Eden with living mush aboard, the mush succeed in working with the billions of NPC mush to defeat you (after game end). It's assumed that with the cure, but without living mush, your team continues to work miracles and manage to reclaim the planet for humans.

On may 29, 2014
DarkTheRaven

Basically it all starts with Chun's storyline: She went off on an expedition to a planet, everyone started puking everywhere and dying for no apparent reason until eventually Chun is the only one left alive, she's then moved to cryogenic storage (for lack of a better term) so they can study her to find what makes her immune to the mush. Jin-Su and Eleesha also link to this storyline at one point or another

The mid portion of the storyline is starting in multiple places all at once mainly Kuan-Ti, Gioelle, Jin-Su, Finola and Eleesha all fit into this part, basically the mush menace starts corrupting government figures while Gioelle funds Kuan-ti's attempts to build a space shuttle capable of reaching the Magallen galaxy(?) or maybe it's a solar system, I forget... Finola meanwhile is researching the mush and creating a Myco Scanner seen in game, and Eleesha is trying to track down her long lost daddy who died in Chun's storyline, she eventually finds Chun and asks her about what happened to her father and the other expedition members, Chun confirms that everyone else died and blah blah blah. Janice and Terrence also come into play here as they create drones capable of thinking(?) or something which eventually gives birth to the monstrosity known as NERON, which is actually a calculator that developed a conscience somehow and started delaying the construction of the Daedleus by constantly screwing with Raluca's PILGRED tests, Janice eventually calms the overgrown calculator by installing the A-TRUE protocol, which allows NERON to select the crew member he sees fit to be leaders.

The latter portion of the storyline brings us into a more odd phase with a few alternate timelines possible. In this part Chao, Derek, Finola, Paola, Frieda and a whole boatload more characters come into play: basically Jin-su tells Derek and Chao to go kidnap Finola and bring her to the daedleus (which is now getting ready to leave Sol to avoid the mush) Either scenario A) Derek dies attempting to acquire Finola but Chao succeeds in retrieving her, or scenario B) Chao dies earlier in the timeline and Derek fails to retrieve Finola. If scenario B happens Andie also joins because they remember Derek from previous things and he's kind of their role model or something... Eleesha also steals her way aboard the Daedleus, Chun already being recruited, so either Chao brings back Finola or Derek shows up and Andie follows just before they launch, Gioelle pressures them into allowing his daughter Paola on board

You're now about up to speed on a basic shell of Mush storyline... probably a bit lacking but it's enough to know what the flying turtle is going on

Q305:
What happens to your active skills and xp gain if Gold Mode expires while you are already on a ship?
On may 29, 2014
[6826491]

A305: You keep any active skills for the remainder of that voyage, but you lose your 3rd and 4th skill slots, if either or both are unused. That applies to both human and Mush skill slots, by the way. Your XP gain drops back to 1 per cycle, and understandably, your max. HP and morale are immediately reduced to 14.
On may 29, 2014
Adoncia

*A305* You keep the skills, but exp gain goes back to normal silver levels right away. So make sure you have picked as many skills as you can before your gold runs out.

[7901021]

Q308 What happens to bananas when they're frozen?
On may 29, 2014
SummerMcLovin

A308: They maintain their current level of decay (check Food Properties) on each subsequent day change. They (along with pills and Coffee) also count towards the "frozen items consumed" achievement but otherwise don't affect how you can eat them.
On may 29, 2014
[6826491]

A308: Also note that eating frozen fruit/coffee costs you 1 morale and 1 AP. You can use the microwave to hyperdefrost the frozen consumables, but that also runs the risk of cutting your Sol link and should be carefully considered. (Also bear in mind that ONLY the microwave can hyperdefrost things; the kitchen has no such option on its own.)

This is not a thread for debates or "unanswerable questions", please.


Too_TonWe killed both mushes but then we still printed out an inconclusive/negative list. I'll send a link after we die in a few cycles

There are two lists.

  • THE list, aka the tabulatrix list, aka Eleesha's list, printed by Eleesha with the Tracker skill, using the tabulatrix on the bridge. It gives 8 names (one less every day), including the name of at least one alpha mush.
  • The Xyloph list, aka Finola's list, aka Finola's lost analysis, obtained by the comms manager thanks to Xyloph DB. It gives a number of random names, some of them "negative" (meaning they were not alpha mush), some of them "inconclusive" (which means that they can be mush or human). The mush can be on the list, but all names can be human. It's totally random.
On may 31, 2014
[7950824]

The list follow up:

Of the two lists, the one that comes from Xyloph will print even if there are no living mush. It prints because of interaction with the comm terminals by the Comm Officer only, it will never be printed unless the comm officer is present (doesn't matter who is Comm Officer though).

The one that Eleesha prints cannot be printed if there are no living mush. It prints, or is attempted to be printed, by interaction directly with the tabulatrix. Only Eleesha can print this list, and if she refuses or dies before doing so, there is no other way to get this list.
